normalised: C-B-S-E Announces Class tenth and twelfth Result Dates

unnormalised: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has officially announced the result dates for the Class 10th and Class 12th board exams. Students and parents across India can now breathe a sigh of relief. The results are expected to be released in 2 phases, starting with the Class 12th results on 20/05/2024 and the Class 10th results to follow on 27/05/2024.
normalised: The Central Board of Secondary Education (C-B-S-E) has officially announced the result dates for the Class tenth and Class twelfth board exams. Students and parents across India can now breathe a sigh of relief. The results are expected to be released in two phases, starting with the Class twelfth results on twentieth May two thousand and twenty four and the Class tenth results to follow on twenty seventh May two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: This year saw over 3.5 million students appear for the exams nationwide, a significant number reflecting the importance of these exams in shaping future academic pathways. The CBSE had previously announced a pass percentage target of 90% overall, aiming for improved performance compared to previous years. Evaluation strategies were revised this year to ensure fairer and more consistent grading.
normalised: This year saw over three point five million students appear for the exams nationwide, a significant number reflecting the importance of these exams in shaping future academic pathways. The C-B-S-E had previously announced a pass percentage target of ninety percent overall, aiming for improved performance compared to previous years. Evaluation strategies were revised this year to ensure fairer and more consistent grading.

unnormalised: The Class 12th exams saw a particularly high number of students opting for the Science stream, with over 1.2 million students taking Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics. The Arts and Commerce streams also witnessed considerable participation, contributing to a diverse academic landscape.
normalised: The Class twelfth exams saw a particularly high number of students opting for the Science stream, with over one point two million students taking Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics. The Arts and Commerce streams also witnessed considerable participation, contributing to a diverse academic landscape.

unnormalised: The Class 10th exams focused on foundational subjects such as Mathematics, Science, Social Science, and English. This year's assessments included a greater emphasis on analytical and problem-solving skills, aligning with the CBSE's focus on holistic education.
normalised: The Class tenth exams focused on foundational subjects such as Mathematics, Science, Social Science, and English. This year's assessments included a greater emphasis on analytical and problem-solving skills, aligning with the C-B-S-E's focus on holistic education.

unnormalised: Students can access their results through the official CBSE website (cbseresults.nic.in) and other partner portals. To view their scores, students will need their roll number, date of birth, and school code. It is advisable to keep these details handy.
normalised: Students can access their results through the official C-B-S-E website (c-b-s-e results dot n-i-c dot in) and other partner portals. To view their scores, students will need their roll number, date of birth, and school code. It is advisable to keep these details handy.

unnormalised: The CBSE has also launched a helpline number, 1800-11-8004, to provide support and guidance to students dealing with exam-related stress or anxiety. Counseling services are available from 9:00 AM to 7:00 PM on all working days.
normalised: The C-B-S-E has also launched a helpline number, one eight hundred hyphen eleven hyphen eight thousand and four, to provide support and guidance to students dealing with exam-related stress or anxiety. Counseling services are available from nine zero zero A-M to seven zero zero P-M on all working days.

unnormalised: The announcement of results marks a significant milestone for students, parents, and educators alike. The CBSE extends its best wishes to all students for their future endeavors. The board encourages all stakeholders to remember that results are just one aspect of a student's overall development, and perseverance and hard work are key to long-term success.
normalised: The announcement of results marks a significant milestone for students, parents, and educators alike. The C-B-S-E extends its best wishes to all students for their future endeavors. The board encourages all stakeholders to remember that results are just one aspect of a student's overall development, and perseverance and hard work are key to long-term success.
